1029.original:
H-0210.1
HOUSE BILL 1029
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Shavers, Reed, Peterson, and Wylie
Prefiled 12/10/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Local Government.
AN ACT Relating to 3D-printed building construction; and adding a new section to chapter 19.27 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 19.27 RCW to read as follows:
(1) Within the adoption cycle for the 2024 Washington state residential code, the state building code council shall amend the Washington state residential code to adopt the 2024 international residential code appendix BM related to 3D-printed building construction.
(2) Within the adoption cycle for the 2027 Washington state residential code, the state building code council shall amend the Washington state residential code to authorize 3D-printed building construction in the main body of the code rather than in an appendix.
--- END ---
1029.summary:
Purpose

The purpose of this bill is to update the Washington state residential code to include regulations for 3D-printed building construction. This update aims to modernize construction practices in the state, reflecting technological advancements. Key changes include the adoption of specific guidelines and regulations for 3D-printed structures, ensuring safety and compliance within the industry.

Key Provisions

Adoption of International Residential Code

  • The state building code council is required to amend the Washington state residential code to adopt the 2024 international residential code appendix BM, which pertains to 3D-printed building construction.

Full Authorization in Main Code

  • By the 2027 adoption cycle of the Washington state residential code, the council must authorize 3D-printed building construction in the main body of the code instead of relegating it to an appendix.
